slideflow.util.verify_tiles(annotations, tfrecord_files=[])[source]¶

Iterate through TFRecord files and verify all have a valid annotation.

Additionally, generate a manifest to log the number of tiles for each slide.

slideflow.util.datasets¶

slideflow.util.datasets.build_validation(train_dir, eval_dir, fraction=0.1)[source]¶
slideflow.util.datasets.make_dir(_dir)[source]¶

Makes a directory if one does not already exist, in a manner compatible with multithreading.

slideflow.util.datasets.merge_validation(train_dir, eval_dir)[source]¶
slideflow.util.datasets.split_tiles(folder, fraction, names)[source]¶

Split a directory of .jpg files into subdirectories.

Parameters

  • folder to search for tiles (folder) –

  • array containing fraction of tiles to include in each subdirectory; (fraction) – remaining tiles will be split among subdirectories with fraction of -1

  • names of subfolder to split tiles. Must be same length as fraction (names) –

slideflow.util.fastim¶

class slideflow.util.fastim.FastImshow(buf, ax, extent=None, tgt_res=512)[source]¶

Bases: object

Fast plotter for large image buffers

Example::

sz = (10000,20000) # rows, cols buf = np.arange(sz[0]*sz[1]).reshape(sz) extent = (100,150,1000,2000) # arbitrary extent fig = plt.figure() ax = fig.add_subplot(111) im = FastImshow(buf,ax,extent=extent,tgt_res=1024) im.show() plt.show()

ax_update(ax)[source]¶

Event handler for re-plotting on zoom - gets bounds in img extent coordinates - converts to buffer coordinates - calculates appropriate strides - sets new data in the axis

get_strides(xstart=0, xend=-1, ystart=0, yend=-1, tgt_res=512)[source]¶
Get sampling strides for a given bounding region. If none is provided,

use the full buffer size

show()[source]¶

Initial plotter for buffer

slideflow.util.tfrecords¶

slideflow.util.tfrecords.assign_case_across_tfrecord(tfrecord_file, case)[source]¶
slideflow.util.tfrecords.checkpoint_to_h5(models_dir, model_name)[source]¶
slideflow.util.tfrecords.image_example(category, case, image_string)[source]¶
slideflow.util.tfrecords.join_tfrecord(input_folder, output_file, assign_case=None)[source]¶

Randomly samples from tfrecords in the input folder with shuffling, and combines into a single tfrecord file.

slideflow.util.tfrecords.print_tfrecord(target)[source]¶

Prints the case names for records in the given tfrecord file

slideflow.util.tfrecords.split_tfrecord(tfrecord_file, output_folder)[source]¶

Splits records from a single tfrecord file into individual tfrecord files by case.

slideflow.util.tfrecords.tfrecord_name_to_case(directory)[source]¶

Opens all tfrecord files within a folder, and for each record, replaces ‘case’ with name of the tfrecord.

slideflow.util.tfrecords.write_tfrecords_merge(input_directory, output_directory, filename, annotations_file=None)[source]¶

Scans a folder for subfolders, assumes subfolders are case names. Assembles all image tiles within subfolders and labels using the provided annotation_dict, assuming the subfolder is the case name. Collects all image tiles and exports into a single tfrecord file.

slideflow.util.tfrecords.write_tfrecords_multi(input_directory, output_directory, annotations_file=None)[source]¶

Scans a folder for subfolders, assumes subfolders are slide names. Assembles all image tiles within subfolders and labels using the provided annotation_dict, assuming the subfolder is the case name. Collects all image tiles and exports into multiple tfrecord files, one for each case.

slideflow.util.tfrecords.write_tfrecords_single(input_directory, output_directory, filename, category, case)[source]¶

Scans a folder for image tiles, annotates using the provided category and case, exports into a single tfrecord file.
